channel.title: Homes on Xiaoyue Cheng's Website
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Xiaoyue Cheng's Website

item.description: Biography Xiaoyue Cheng is an assistant professor of mathematics in University of Nebraska at Omaha. Her research interests include statistical visualization, interactive graphics, machine learning, classification, Exploratory data analysis, missing data analysis, time series, statistical simulation and computing.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Courses that I taught as an instructor: University of Nebraska at Omaha STAT 3000⁄8005 - Statistical Methods I, 2015 Fall, 2016 Spring, 2016 Fall, 2017 Spring STAT 3800⁄8805 - Applied Engineering Probability and Statistics, 2015 Fall, 2016 Spring STAT 4440⁄8446 - Time Series Analysis, 2017 Spring, 2018 Spring MATH/STAT 4450⁄8456 - Introduction to Maching Learning and Data Mining, 2016 Fall, 2018 Spring MATH 3200 - Mathematical Computing II, 2017 Spring, 2018 Spring.
